It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1834 Oct. 25
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from Saturday October 25, 1834. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Saturday October 25th
div.p: Court met according to adjournment Present as on yesterday.

Tekon oh tah hee
vs
A. toh la hee

To all and Singulor to whoom whom it may Concearn Concern know ye that for and on consideration of the Sum of one hundred and fifty dollars received from Prince a black man Slave we do by these presents emancipate and Let him free and will defend him a gainst against the Claim or Claims of any other person or persons whatever in witness where of we have here unto Let our hands and seals this 10th day January 1834
Witness Present
Lewis Ross
John Miller
Caty Richmond her mark/seal
Annay Richmond her mark/seal
Beg Drum his mark & seal

I do Certyfy Certify that the above is a true coppy copy of the original
Charles H. Vann
Court find for Pltff Plaintiff the five head of Cattle, or the value thereof in other good property. 25th Octr. October 1834-
Court adjourned untill until monday morning 9 o clock
